channel.description: Recent content in industry on The ERC Blog

item.title: Robotic Arms: A Brief
item.description: Most of the world’s robots are designed for hard, repetitive production work. They perform activities that human beings find complicated, dangerous or tedious. The most common production robot is a robotic arm. A robotic arm is a device that is programmed to carry out a particular task with extreme accuracy at a rapid pace with great efficiency. History of the arm The idea of a robot arm is not new. The first robotic arm was designed by Leonardo da Vinci in the late fifteenth century.
